item.title: Wyden proposes bill to secure US telecoms after Salt Typhoon hacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: U.S. Senator Ron Wyden of Oregon announced a new bill to secure the networks of American telecommunications companies breached by Salt Typhoon Chinese state hackers earlier this year. [...]

item.title: WPForms bug allows Stripe refunds on millions of WordPress sites
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A vulnerability in WPForms, a WordPress plugin used in over 6 million websites, could allow subscriber-level users to issue arbitrary Stripe refunds or cancel subscriptions. [...]

item.title: Ivanti warns of maximum severity CSA auth bypass vulnerability
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Ivanti warned customers on Tuesday about a new maximum-severity authentication bypass vulnerability in its Cloud Services Appliance (CSA) solution. [...]

item.title: Windows 10 KB5048652 update fixes new motherboard activation bug
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Microsoft has released the KB5048652 cumulative update for Windows 10 22H2, which contains six fixes, including a fix that prevented Windows 10 from activating when you change a device's motherboard. [...]

item.title: Microsoft December 2024 Patch Tuesday fixes 1 exploited zero-day, 71 flaws
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Today is Microsoft's December 2024 Patch Tuesday, which includes security updates for 71 flaws, including one actively exploited zero-day vulnerability. [...]

item.title: Windows 11 KB5048667 & KB5048685 cumulative updates released
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: Microsoft has released the Windows 11 KB5048667 and KB5048685 cumulative updates for versions 24H2 and 23H2 to fix security vulnerabilities and issues. [...]

item.title: FTC distributes $72 million in Fortnite refunds from Epic Games
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The Federal Trade Commission (FTC) is distributing over $72 million in Epic Game Fortnite refunds for the company's use of dark patterns to trick players into making unwanted purchases. [...]

item.title: US sanctions Chinese firm for hacking firewalls in ransomware attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The U.S. Treasury Department has sanctioned Chinese cybersecurity company Sichuan Silence and one of its employees for their involvement in a series of Ragnarok ransomware attacks targeting U.S. critical infrastructure companies and many other victims worldwide in April 2020. [...]

item.title: New Cleo zero-day RCE flaw exploited in data theft attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Hackers are actively exploiting a zero-day vulnerability in Cleo managed file transfer software to breach corporate networks and conduct data theft attacks. [...]

item.title: Inside the incident: Uncovering an advanced phishing attack
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Varonis
item.description: Recently, Varonis investigated a phishing campaign in which a malicious email enabled a threat actor to access the organization. This blog post will reveal the tactics used to avoid detection and share what was discovered during the investigation. [...]

item.title: Microsoft 365 outage takes down Office web apps, admin center
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft is investigating a widespread and ongoing Microsoft 365 outage impacting Office web apps and the Microsoft 365 admin center. [...]

item.title: Chinese hackers use Visual Studio Code tunnels for remote access
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Chinese hackers targeting large IT service providers in Southern Europe were seen abusing Visual Studio Code (VSCode) tunnels to maintain persistent access to compromised systems. [...]

item.title: Ransomware attack hits leading heart surgery device maker
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Artivion, a leading manufacturer of heart surgery medical devices, has disclosed a November 21 ransomware attack that disrupted its operations and forced it to take some systems offline. [...]
